title: Executive Order 8263-Exemption of William F. Mackenzie From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that William F. Mackenzie, examiner of merchandise, United States Customs Service, Treasury Department, who, during the current month, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said William F. Mackenzie from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending September 30, 1940.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8263-Exemption of William F. Mackenzie From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362974
